result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin A Long was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Devin A Long
parties.address: W8356 Nancy Lake Road, Minong, WI 54859

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. Court grants 71 days credit if revoked from probation.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must sign up for probation by 2/21/2017

miscConds.notes: $200.00 cash bond applied. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 71 days credit - time served.
